title: Integrative Teaching Design of Meaning and Sensibility in Mathematics Education: An Ontosemiotic Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and fundamental experience in educational settings
context.additional_context: For in-service practitioners (teachers/educators), enhancing competencies in understanding meaning-making processes in math education and designing instruction using onto-semiotic approaches

learning_goals: Students can apply the core concepts of the onto-semiotic approach (object, sign, meaning) to mathematics education.
Students develop the ability to integrate and analyze symbols, contexts, and cognitive elements to form the meaning and sensory understanding of mathematical concepts.
Students can design mobile-optimized microlearning activities to facilitate learners' meaning-making processes.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
